result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
11:04 AM Defendant Devion D Hughes appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Ricardo Tapia in court for Devion D Hughes. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. 

First appearance in trial court after waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Defense requests another status date. Defense has discovery, but does not have a pre-trial offer. 
State does not have a pre-trial offer to share. 

Defense states that the Defendant should be out of custody by the next scheduled hearing date.
Hearing scheduled for December 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Search Warrant Executed on 10/25/2022 - Apple IPhone

SEARCH WARRANT
ENDORSEMENT ON WARRANT
RETURN OF OFFICER
AFFIDAVIT

9:11 AM Defendant Devion D Hughes in court, in custody.  Attorney Ricardo Tapia in court for Devion D Hughes.  Prosecuting attorney Ted Szczupakiewicz in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Bail remains as fixed. 
Defendant to be returned to Milwaukee County Jail forthwith.  
Clerk's office to set up video appearance from Milwaukee County Jail for the next date.
Hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
